page.title: 16Art/Craft, Stallingborough
page.content: The only professional craftsmen in the village are the joiner and the blacksmith, so most craftwork is only done to modest standards as a hobby.Recently people have had more time for leisure activities because of labour-saving equipment in homes, and through unemployment. Both boys and girls at the comprehensive school do metal work, woodwork, pottery and needlework as well as the more basic art subjects. Crafts such as dressmaking and pottery can be learned at adult evening classes. Mothers and grandmothers knit for children, and fashion knitting is increasing in popularity. Electronic knitting machines can be used in the home. Sewing machines too are becoming more sophisticated, providing an opportunity to provide more professional results.
